intro: Pedicularis bracteosa var. siifolia, commonly known as the Sierra beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and showy, two-lipped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are typically opposite and lance-shaped, and it often grows in rocky or alpine habitats. This variety is distinguished by its narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to thrive in high-altitude environments.
